intro: Seidenfia josephiana, commonly known as the Joseph's seidenfia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with hairy stems and broad, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pale pink, bloom in clusters and attract various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Seidenfia josephiana is often found in moist, well-drained soils near rivers and in forest understories.
